New Records: Pakistan posted their fifth-highest score against South Africa in T20Is
Shadab Khan scored his first T20I fifty
Shadab Khan and Iftikhar Ahmed put on a 52-run stand in 38 balls
Key Match Events: Pakistan recovered from 95 for 5 to post a competitive score
Shaheen Shah Afridi dismissed Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw cheaply
Temba Bavuma had his best innings of 2022
Shadab Khan found Bavuma's edge and removed Aiden Markram with a topspinner
Tristan Stubbs and Heinrich Klaasen biffed it around but the ask was always going to be too tall
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam decided to bat after Temba Bavuma called incorrectly
Pakistan made a change to their line-up with Mohammad Haris replacing Fakhar Zaman
South Africa had two changes to their XI with Heinrich Klaasen and Tabraiz Shamsi replacing David Miller and Keshav Maharaj
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan kept their semi-final hopes alive with victory
South Africa remain second on the points' table and need to beat Netherlands on Sunday to keep their fate in their own hands
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, reducing the game to 14 overs
South Africa dropped five catches, more than they have in the other three matches in the tournament combined
Pakistan's top-order failed to fire once again, but Iftikhar Ahmed and Shadab Khan scored half-centuries apiece
